original: @269b / /rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @269b / /rgya gar skad du /

analyzed: a'arya dharma t'a sva bh'a wa sh'u n+ya ta aa tsa la pra ti sarba a'a lo ka s'u tra /

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa chos nyid rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid las mi g-yo bar tha dad par thams cad la snang ba'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa chos nyid rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid las mi g-yo bar tha dad par thams cad la snang ba'i mdo /
translated: The noble s≈´tra of the appearance of everything individually from the emptiness of the essence of the nature of phenomena

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //üîΩ'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na; bcom ldan 'das ri dvags kyi rgyal po'i chos kyi khang pa na ye shes kyi khyad par las grub pa'i rin po che sna tshogs kyi khri chen po bshams pa la chos nyid rang gi ngo bo nyid ji lta
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo // 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na; bcom ldan 'das ri dvags kyi rgyal po'i chos kyi khang pa na ye shes kyi khyad par las grub pa'i rin po che sna tshogs kyi khri chen po bshams pa la chos nyid rang gi ngo bo nyid ji lta
translated: Homage to all the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: ba las mi g-yo bar bzhugs so //
analyzed: ba las mi g-yo bar bzhugs so //
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time, the BhagavƒÅn was dwelling in the Dharma abode of the king of deer, seated on a great lion throne of various precious substances formed from the distinctions of wisdom, without moving from the nature of the essence of phenomena just as it is.

original: de'i tshe gnas der byang chub sems dpa' chen po tshad med grangs med pa dag kyang 'dus /
analyzed: de'i tshe gnas der byang chub sems dpa' chen po tshad med grangs med pa dag kyang 'dus /
translated: At that time, immeasurable and countless great bodhisattvas had also gathered in that place.

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin la sogs pa @270a *//
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin la sogs pa @270a *//
translated: Devas, humans, asuras, and so forth

original: 'khor phal po che thams cad kyang 'dus par gyur to //
analyzed: 'khor phal po che thams cad kyang 'dus par gyur to //
translated: The entire great assembly gathered.

original: de nas 'khor 'dus pa thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das la yang dang yang du bskor ba byed cing phyag btsal te rang rang gi phyogs phyogs su 'dug ste mchod pa'i mchog thams cad kyis mchod par byed /
analyzed: de nas 'khor 'dus pa thams cad kyis bcom ldan 'das la yang dang yang du bskor ba byed cing phyag btsal te rang rang gi phyogs phyogs su 'dug ste mchod pa'i mchog thams cad kyis mchod par byed /
translated: Then the entire assembled retinue circumambulated the BhagavƒÅn again and again, bowed to him, and sat down in their respective places. They made offerings with all the supreme offerings,

original: bsti stang du byed /
analyzed: bsti stang du byed /
translated: honored him,

original: ri mor byed pa la yid skyo bar mi byed de /
analyzed: ri mor byed pa la yid skyo bar mi byed de /
translated: and venerated him without becoming weary.

original: chos nyan par brtsams te mgo btud nas 'dug par gyur to //
analyzed: chos nyan par brtsams te mgo btud nas 'dug par gyur to //
translated: They began to listen to the Dharma, their heads bowed.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das ni rnam grangs dang dbye ba'i chos la rtog par mi mdzad kyang smon lam dang thugs rje'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'khor rnams kyi so so'i mos pa dang bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsung sgrogs bar snang ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das ni rnam grangs dang dbye ba'i chos la rtog par mi mdzad kyang smon lam dang thugs rje'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'khor rnams kyi so so'i mos pa dang bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du gsung sgrogs bar snang ste /
translated: At that time, although the BhagavƒÅn did not contemplate the Dharma of categories and divisions, by the power of his aspirations and compassion, the sound of his speech resounded in the sky in accordance with the individual aspirations and thoughts of the retinue.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bdag la chos ston te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bdag la chos ston te /
translated: Each one thought, The BhagavƒÅn is teaching the Dharma to me,

original: gzhan dag la ni ma yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni ma yin no snyam mo //
translated: not to others.

original: de'ang 'khor phal po che de dag las kyang kha cig gis ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod pa'i chos ston to snyam ste /
analyzed: de'ang 'khor phal po che de dag las kyang kha cig gis ni ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod pa'i chos ston to snyam ste /
translated: Some of the members of that vast retinue thought that the Dharma was being taught as it appears,

original: de la nges par 'dzin cing rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de la nges par 'dzin cing rtog par byed do //
translated: and they conceived of it and imagined it in that way.

original: kha cig gis ni chos thams cad sems tsam las ma gtogs par gzhan med pa'i chos ston te snyam ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni chos thams cad sems tsam las ma gtogs par gzhan med pa'i chos ston te snyam ste /
translated: Some thought that the Dharma was being taught as the mind alone, with nothing other than that existing,

original: de la nges par 'dzin cing rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de la nges par 'dzin cing rtog par byed do //
translated: and they conceived of it and imagined it in that way.

original: kha cig gis ni sems nyid kyang ma skyes pa yin par bdag cag la chos ston to snyam ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni sems nyid kyang ma skyes pa yin par bdag cag la chos ston to snyam ste /
translated: Some thought that the Dharma was being taught to them that the mind itself is unborn,

original: de la nges par 'dzin cing rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de la nges par 'dzin cing rtog par byed do //
translated: and they conceived of it and imagined it in that way.

original: kha cig gis ni chos thams cad sgyu ma bzhin du snang zhing sgyu ma @270b bzhin du ma grub pa'i chos ston to snyam ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni chos thams cad sgyu ma bzhin du snang zhing sgyu ma @270b bzhin du ma grub pa'i chos ston to snyam ste /
translated: Some thought that the Dharma was being taught that all phenomena appear like illusions but are not established like illusions,

original: de la nges par 'dzin cing rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de la nges par 'dzin cing rtog par byed do //
translated: and they conceived of it and imagined it in that way.

original: kha cig gis ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa /
translated: Some thought that the Dharma was being taught that all phenomena are by nature unborn,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis mi gnas pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis mi gnas pa /
translated: that they do not abide by their very essence,üîΩand that they are by nature unceasing.

original: las dang bya ba'i mtha' thams cad dang bral ba rtog pa dang rtog pa'i yul las 'das pa /
analyzed: las dang bya ba'i mtha' thams cad dang bral ba rtog pa dang rtog pa'i yul las 'das pa /
translated: He is free from all actions and activities, and he is beyond thought and the objects of thought.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa rnam par dag pa'i chos ston to snyam ste /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa rnam par dag pa'i chos ston to snyam ste /
translated: He teaches the Dharma of the purity of elaborations from beginningless time.‚Äù

original: de la nges par 'dzin cing rtog par byed do //üîΩde nas bcom ldan 'das chos nyid rang gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba las mi g-yo bar bzhugs pa de las snying rje dang ldan pa'i skur byas nas 'khor 'dus pa de dag gi lta ba tha dad par gyur pa'i rtog pa'i mun pa sel ba zhes
analyzed: de la nges par 'dzin cing rtog par byed do // de nas bcom ldan 'das chos nyid rang gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba las mi g-yo bar bzhugs pa de las snying rje dang ldan pa'i skur byas nas 'khor 'dus pa de dag gi lta ba tha dad par gyur pa'i rtog pa'i mun pa sel ba zhes
translated: He thus grasps and conceptualizes that.

original: bya ba'i 'od zer ljags kyi dbang po las spros te /
analyzed: bya ba'i 'od zer ljags kyi dbang po las spros te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, without moving from his own essence, the nature of phenomena, emanated light rays from his tongue called ‚ÄúDispelling the Darkness of the Different Views and Concepts of the Assembled Followers.‚Äù

original: 'od zer des phyogs bcu thams cad snang bar byas nas 'khor de na byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal 'dug par gyur pa la bskul bas byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis 'khor phal mo che'i rtog pa lnga po tha dad par gyur pa sems kyis shes nas;
analyzed: 'od zer des phyogs bcu thams cad snang bar byas nas 'khor de na byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal 'dug par gyur pa la bskul bas byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis 'khor phal mo che'i rtog pa lnga po tha dad par gyur pa sems kyis shes nas;
translated: The light illuminated all ten directions and awakened the bodhisattva Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, who was present in the assembly. The bodhisattva Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ knew the different thoughts of the vast assembly.

original: ci'i phyir chos thams cad kyi gzhi gcig la lta ba dang mos pa tha dad par gyur snyam ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos thams cad kyi gzhi gcig la lta ba dang mos pa tha dad par gyur snyam ste /
translated: He wondered, ‚ÄúWhy do they have different views and aspirations regarding the single basis of all phenomena?‚Äù

original: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das la zhu par bya'o snyam pa dang / 'od zer de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi ljags kyi dbang po la slar 'dus par gyur to //
analyzed: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das la zhu par bya'o snyam pa dang / 'od zer de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi ljags kyi dbang po la slar 'dus par gyur to //
translated: He thought, ‚ÄúI will ask the Blessed One,‚Äù and the light then reabsorbed into the Blessed One‚Äôs tongue.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ said to the Blessed One,

original: @271a *// bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: @271a *// bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rnam grangs dang dbye ba'i chos la rtog par mi mdzad kyang 'khor 'dus pa 'di dag mos pa dang rtog pa tha dad pa 'di ci las gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rnam grangs dang dbye ba'i chos la rtog par mi mdzad kyang 'khor 'dus pa 'di dag mos pa dang rtog pa tha dad pa 'di ci las gyur /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn does not contemplate the categorized and differentiated Dharma, but what caused this assembly to have different aspirations and thoughts?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: BhagavƒÅn,

original: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag kun yang dag pa lags sam /
analyzed: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag kun yang dag pa lags sam /
translated: are these five limits of investigating the Dharma all correct?

original: 'on te kha cig ni yang dag pa lags la /
analyzed: 'on te kha cig ni yang dag pa lags la /
translated: Or are some correct

original: kha cig ni yang dag pa ma lags sam /
analyzed: kha cig ni yang dag pa ma lags sam /
translated: and some not correct?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: BhagavƒÅn,

analyzed: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag gis rnam par grol ba thob par mtshungs lags sam /
translated: are those who attain liberation through these five limits of investigating the Dharma the same?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: BhagavƒÅn,

original: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la gang zag gi rigs ni mchis lags sam /
analyzed: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la gang zag gi rigs ni mchis lags sam /
translated: are there types of individuals in these five limits of investigating the Dharma?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: BhagavƒÅn,

original: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la tha dad par snang ba'i mthun pa'i dpe ni ji ltar lags /
analyzed: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la tha dad par snang ba'i mthun pa'i dpe ni ji ltar lags /
translated: what are the concordant examples of the appearances of differences in these five limits of investigating the Dharma?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: BhagavƒÅn,

original: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag ltar so sor rtog pa'i gang zag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ba lags sam /
analyzed: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag ltar so sor rtog pa'i gang zag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ba lags sam /
translated: Will there be people in the future who will individually investigate these five limits of the Dharma?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la slob pa'i gang zag rnams don lags pa dang ma lags par rtsod par mi 'gyur lags sam; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la slob pa'i gang zag rnams don lags pa dang ma lags par rtsod par mi 'gyur lags sam; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: will those who train in these five limits of the Dharma not dispute the meaning of what is and is not? Blessed One,

original: 'khor 'dus pa 'di dag gi the tshom gyi dra ba bcad pa'i slad du bdag la bshad du gsol /
analyzed: 'khor 'dus pa 'di dag gi the tshom gyi dra ba bcad pa'i slad du bdag la bshad du gsol /
translated: please explain this to me in order to cut through the web of doubts of this gathered assembly.‚Äù

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: When he had thus requested, the Blessed One

original: @271b kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: @271b kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: said this:

original: 'jam dpal / khyod 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod 'di skad du /
translated: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, you have said,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni rnam grangs dang dbye ba'i chos la rtog par mi mdzad kyang 'khor 'dus pa 'di dag 'di ltar mos pa dang rtog pa tha dad pa ci las gyur zhes zer ba ni sbyangs pa dang ma sbyangs pa'i dbang las shes pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni rnam grangs dang dbye ba'i chos la rtog par mi mdzad kyang 'khor 'dus pa 'di dag 'di ltar mos pa dang rtog pa tha dad pa ci las gyur zhes zer ba ni sbyangs pa dang ma sbyangs pa'i dbang las shes pa dang /
translated: ‚ÄòBlessed One, you do not investigate the Dharma of categories and divisions, but why is it that the inclinations and thoughts of this gathered assembly are so different?‚Äô This is understood from the power of training and not training.

original: mos pa che chung las gyur te /
analyzed: mos pa che chung las gyur te /
translated: It is due to the difference in their great or small aspiration.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni sbyangs pa dang bsags pa dpag tu med pas rtsol ba med par chos nyid rang gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba las mi g-yo ba gcig pu yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni sbyangs pa dang bsags pa dpag tu med pas rtsol ba med par chos nyid rang gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba las mi g-yo ba gcig pu yin te /
translated: The Buddhas, by means of immeasurable purification and accumulation, are the only ones who, without effort, do not move from the nature of reality just as it is.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod yul yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyod yul yin no //
translated: This is the domain of all Buddhas.

original: cher sbyangs pa dang cung zad sbyangs pa rnams kyi ni yang dag pa yin pa dang ma yin pa brgyud pa las thob pa ste /
analyzed: cher sbyangs pa dang cung zad sbyangs pa rnams kyi ni yang dag pa yin pa dang ma yin pa brgyud pa las thob pa ste /
translated: Those who have purified themselves greatly and those who have purified themselves slightly attain it through the succession of the real and the unreal.

original: de'i phyir na mos pa dang rtog pa tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir na mos pa dang rtog pa tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, aspiration and imagination become different.

original: 'jam dpal / khyod 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod 'di skad du /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, you said this:

original: chos la brtags pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag kun yang dag pa lags sam /üîΩ'on te kha cig ni yang dag pa lags la /
analyzed: chos la brtags pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag kun yang dag pa lags sam / 'on te kha cig ni yang dag pa lags la /
translated: Are all these five limits of the investigation of phenomena real?üîΩOr are some real

original: kha cig ni yang dag pa ma lags sam zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: kha cig ni yang dag pa ma lags sam zhes zer ba ni /
translated: and some not real?

original: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag thams cad kyang yang dag pa yin par gzung ste /
analyzed: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag thams cad kyang yang dag pa yin par gzung ste /
translated: All these five limits of the investigation of phenomena should be taken as real.

original: kha cig gis ni chos thams cad ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod pa'i chos ston to snyam pa'ang yin te /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni chos thams cad ji ltar snang ba bzhin du yod pa'i chos ston to snyam pa'ang yin te /
translated: Some think that the Dharma teaches that all phenomena exist as they appear.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'byung ba bzhi dang des byas pa rnams ni tha dad du sgyu ma bzhin du yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkha cig gis ni chos thams cad ni sems tsam las ma gtogs pa gzhan med pa'i chos ston te /
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi dang des byas pa rnams ni tha dad du sgyu ma bzhin du yod pa'i phyir ro // kha cig gis ni chos thams cad ni sems tsam las ma gtogs pa gzhan med pa'i chos ston te /
translated: Because the four elements and what they produce exist separately, like illusions.

original: @272a *// snyam pa'ang yin te /
analyzed: @272a *// snyam pa'ang yin te /
translated: Some think that the Dharma teaches that all phenomena are only mind and do not exist separately.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: chos sna tshogs su 'dogs pa rnams rtag pa ther zug tu brtags pa'i bag chags sems la bzhag pa'i mthus dus thams cad du bdag dang chos rnams su snang ba tha snyad tsam dus nang yang don du rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: chos sna tshogs su 'dogs pa rnams rtag pa ther zug tu brtags pa'i bag chags sems la bzhag pa'i mthus dus thams cad du bdag dang chos rnams su snang ba tha snyad tsam dus nang yang don du rang bzhin med de /
translated: Because all the various designations of phenomena are imputed as permanent and stable, and by the power of being placed in the mind as latent tendencies, all phenomena appear as self and phenomena, but in reality they are not inherently existent even conventionally,

original: sems tsam las med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems tsam las med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are only mind.

original: kha cig gis ni sems nyid kyang ma skyes ba yin par bdag cag la chos ston to snyam pa'ang yin te /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni sems nyid kyang ma skyes ba yin par bdag cag la chos ston to snyam pa'ang yin te /
translated: Some think that the Dharma teaches us that even the mind itself is unborn.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di la dbyibs sam /
analyzed: 'di la dbyibs sam /
translated: Because it has no shape,

original: kha dog gam /
analyzed: kha dog gam /
translated: no color,

original: dus gsum mam /
analyzed: dus gsum mam /
translated: no three times,

original: mtha' dbus med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' dbus med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and no center or periphery.

original: kha cig gis ni chos thams cad sgyu ma bzhin du snang zhing sgyu ma bzhin du ma grub pa'i chos ston to snyam pa'ang yin te /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni chos thams cad sgyu ma bzhin du snang zhing sgyu ma bzhin du ma grub pa'i chos ston to snyam pa'ang yin te /
translated: Some think that the Dharma is taught as an illusion, appearing as all phenomena but not established as an illusion.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad ni rgyu rkyen las skye zhing 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rgyu rkyen las skye zhing 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena arise and occur from causes and conditions.

original: kha cig gis ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyi ma skyes pa /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyi ma skyes pa /
translated: Some think that the Dharma is taught as all phenomena being intrinsically unborn,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis mi gnas pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis mi gnas pa /
translated: essentially non-abiding,

original: las dang bya ba'i mtha' thams cad dang bral ba /
analyzed: las dang bya ba'i mtha' thams cad dang bral ba /
translated: free from all actions and activities,

original: rtog pa dang rtog pa'i yul las 'das pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang rtog pa'i yul las 'das pa /
translated: beyond thought and the domain of thought,

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa rnam par dag pa'i chos ston to snyam pa'ang yin te /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa rnam par dag pa'i chos ston to snyam pa'ang yin te /
translated: and as the phenomena of pure freedom from elaborations since beginningless time.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid phyin ci ma log pa de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid phyin ci ma log pa de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the unmistaken intrinsic essence of all phenomena.

original: 'jam dpal / yang kha cig yang dag pa ma yin par yang bzung ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / yang kha cig yang dag pa ma yin par yang bzung ste /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, some, having grasped what is not real,

original: sbyangs pa chung ba /
analyzed: sbyangs pa chung ba /
translated: have little training,

original: mos pa dman pa /
analyzed: mos pa dman pa /
translated: have inferior aspiration,

original: shes rab zhan pa dag gis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab zhan pa dag gis rtogs pa'o //
translated: and have weak wisdom.

original: @272b kha cig sbyangs pa dang / mos pa dang / shes rab 'bring ba rnams kyis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: @272b kha cig sbyangs pa dang / mos pa dang / shes rab 'bring ba rnams kyis rtogs pa'o //
translated: Some, having middling training, middling aspiration, and middling wisdom, understand.

original: lhag ma ni yang dag pa ste mchog tu gyur pa'i rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni yang dag pa ste mchog tu gyur pa'i rtogs pa'o //
translated: The rest is the correct, supreme understanding.

original: 'jam dpal / khyod 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod 'di skad du /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, you asked,

original: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag gis rnam par grol ba thob par mtshungs sam zer ba ni /
analyzed: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag gis rnam par grol ba thob par mtshungs sam zer ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄòAre those five limits of investigation of the Dharma the same in attaining liberation?‚Äô

original: shes rab mchog tu gyur pa'i rtogs pa yang dag pa las lhag ma bzhi po gcig la gcig brgyud pa'i khyad par gyis nye ring yod kyang rnam par grol ba thob par mtshungs par blta'o //
analyzed: shes rab mchog tu gyur pa'i rtogs pa yang dag pa las lhag ma bzhi po gcig la gcig brgyud pa'i khyad par gyis nye ring yod kyang rnam par grol ba thob par mtshungs par blta'o //
translated: The correct, supreme understanding should be seen as the same in attaining liberation, while the other four, due to the difference of one following after the other, have a near and far.

original: 'jam dpal / khyod kyis 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod kyis 'di skad du /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, you asked,üîΩ‚ÄòAre those five limits of investigation of the Dharma the same in attaining liberation?‚Äô

original: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la gang zag gi rigs ni mchis lags sam zhes zer ba ni theg pa chung ngu'i rigs dang theg pa chen po'i rigs gnyis kyis chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga las bzhi las brgyud nas lhag ma gcig tu yang
analyzed: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la gang zag gi rigs ni mchis lags sam zhes zer ba ni theg pa chung ngu'i rigs dang theg pa chen po'i rigs gnyis kyis chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga las bzhi las brgyud nas lhag ma gcig tu yang
translated: When he said, Are there any types of people who have these five extremes of investigating phenomena? he was referring to the two types of people: those of the Hƒ´nayƒÅna type and those of the MahƒÅyƒÅna type.

original: dag pa phyin ci ma log pa sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul rtogs par bya'o //üîΩ'jam dpal / khyod 'di skad du /
analyzed: dag pa phyin ci ma log pa sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul rtogs par bya'o // 'jam dpal / khyod 'di skad du /
translated: From among the five extremes of investigating phenomena, those of the Hƒ´nayƒÅna type will, through the four, come to realize the unmistaken, pure object of the buddhas, which is the remainder, the fifth.

original: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la tha dad par snang ba'i mthun pa'i dpe ni ji ltar lags zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la tha dad par snang ba'i mthun pa'i dpe ni ji ltar lags zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, when you asked, What are the concordant examples for the five extremes of investigating phenomena?

original: chos kyi gzhi gcig la tha dad par rtog pa'i dpe ni dzambu'i gling du nyi ma 'char bas bstan te /
analyzed: chos kyi gzhi gcig la tha dad par rtog pa'i dpe ni dzambu'i gling du nyi ma 'char bas bstan te /
translated: The example for the investigation of a single basis of phenomena as being different is taught by the rising of the sun over the land of India.

original: dzambu'i gling du nyi ma 'char ba dpag tshad bzhi khri'i nam mkha' las 'char ba'i tshe mi rnams kyis rang gi grong khyer dang ri 'di las shar bar so so nas rtog go /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling du nyi ma 'char ba dpag tshad bzhi khri'i nam mkha' las 'char ba'i tshe mi rnams kyis rang gi grong khyer dang ri 'di las shar bar so so nas rtog go /
translated: When the sun rises in Jambudvƒ´pa, it rises in the sky from a distance of forty thousand yojanas, and people each think, ‚ÄúThe sun has risen from my city or mountain.‚ÄùüîΩIn the same way, the assembly gathered here each thinks,

original: de bzhin du de ltar gyi 'khor 'dus pa 'di dag gis chos kyi gzhi gci @273a *//üîΩla so sor rtog go /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ltar gyi 'khor 'dus pa 'di dag gis chos kyi gzhi gci @273a *// la so sor rtog go /
translated: ‚ÄúThe Dharma has arisen for me.‚Äù

original: so sor mthong ngo //
analyzed: so sor mthong ngo //
translated: They each see it.

original: so sor 'dzin to //üîΩ'jal dpal / rnam par ma brtags pa'i tshe rang gi grong khyer gyi ri las mi 'char ba ma yin pa bzhin du chos la brtag pa'i mtha' 'di dag kyang yang dag pa phyin ci ma log pa sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul la ma ltos pa gzhan bzhi po de
analyzed: so sor 'dzin to // 'jal dpal / rnam par ma brtags pa'i tshe rang gi grong khyer gyi ri las mi 'char ba ma yin pa bzhin du chos la brtag pa'i mtha' 'di dag kyang yang dag pa phyin ci ma log pa sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul la ma ltos pa gzhan bzhi po de
translated: They each grasp it.

original: bzhin du snang ngo //
analyzed: bzhin du snang ngo //
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, just as the sun does not rise from one‚Äôs own city or mountain when it is not analyzed, in the same way, these limits of analysis of phenomena are seen by the four others who do not rely on the domain of the buddhas, the unerring, true reality.

original: 'jam dpal / rang gi grong khyer gyi ri de las yang dag par 'char ba ma yin pa de bzhin du bzhi po ni rtogs pa'i thabs blo'i rim pa la de ltar snang ste /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / rang gi grong khyer gyi ri de las yang dag par 'char ba ma yin pa de bzhin du bzhi po ni rtogs pa'i thabs blo'i rim pa la de ltar snang ste /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, just as the sun does not rise over the mountains of one‚Äôs own city, so the four appear in that way to the stages of the intellect that are the means of realization,

original: don yang dag pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: don yang dag pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: but they are not the reality of the meaning.

original: 'jam dpal / brtag pa lnga po 'di dag las rnam par grol ba mtshungs pa thob pa'i dpe ni nor bu rin po ches bstan te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / brtag pa lnga po 'di dag las rnam par grol ba mtshungs pa thob pa'i dpe ni nor bu rin po ches bstan te /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, the example of attaining the same freedom from these five investigations is taught by the precious jewel.

original: rin po che de'ang sems can rnams kyis bsten pa'i las byas pa dang ma byas pa yod de /
analyzed: rin po che de'ang sems can rnams kyis bsten pa'i las byas pa dang ma byas pa yod de /
translated: That jewel is also attended to by sentient beings, some of whom have performed the activity and some of whom have not.

original: gang zag rtog pa med pa dang log par rtog pa rnams kyis ni chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga la mi rten pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag rtog pa med pa dang log par rtog pa rnams kyis ni chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga la mi rten pa ste /
translated: Those who do not conceive or conceive wrongly do not rely on the five extremes of investigating phenomena.

original: rin po che bsten pa'i las ma byas pa'i gang zag gis rin po che mi rnyed pa dang / dgos pa mi 'byung ba bzhin du de dag la mi dpyod mi sems pas khams gsum las mi thar pa yin no //
analyzed: rin po che bsten pa'i las ma byas pa'i gang zag gis rin po che mi rnyed pa dang / dgos pa mi 'byung ba bzhin du de dag la mi dpyod mi sems pas khams gsum las mi thar pa yin no //
translated: Just as a person who has not performed the activity of attending to the jewel does not obtain the jewel and does not obtain the purpose, they do not analyze and do not think about those, and therefore they are not liberated from the three realms.

original: bsten pa'i las byas pa ni khyad par du bsags pa dang / cher bsags pa dang / cung zad bsags pa dang / cung zad bsags pa rnams la rin po che'i dgos pa'ang rim pa gsum du 'byung ba de bzhin du yang @273b dag pa phyin ci ma log pa dang /
analyzed: bsten pa'i las byas pa ni khyad par du bsags pa dang / cher bsags pa dang / cung zad bsags pa dang / cung zad bsags pa rnams la rin po che'i dgos pa'ang rim pa gsum du 'byung ba de bzhin du yang @273b dag pa phyin ci ma log pa dang /
translated: The activity of relying on the spiritual master is also threefold: relying on the spiritual master with a special accumulation of merit, with a great accumulation of merit, and with a small accumulation of merit.üîΩ

original: lhag ma bzhi po brgyud par brtag pa theg pa che chung rim pa gsum yang dpe rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma bzhi po brgyud par brtag pa theg pa che chung rim pa gsum yang dpe rim pa bzhin no //
translated: The activity of reliance is the accumulation of merit in particular, the great accumulation, the small accumulation, and the very small accumulation. Just as the precious needs arise in three stages, likewise, the five perfections are the basis of the perfection of wisdom.üîΩThe five perfections are the basis of the perfection of wisdom.

original: ngas bshad pa'i mdo sde bcu gnyis dang / chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga ji lta bu yin pa'i dpe ni rgya mtsho la phyogs bzhi nas chu 'bab pas bstan te /
analyzed: ngas bshad pa'i mdo sde bcu gnyis dang / chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga ji lta bu yin pa'i dpe ni rgya mtsho la phyogs bzhi nas chu 'bab pas bstan te /
translated: The analogy for the five perfections is the four rivers that flow from the four directions into the ocean.

original: phyogs bzhi nas chu bo bzhi yan lag mang po dang bcas pa phyogs bzhi nas babs kyang gzhi rgya mtsho chen po las babs par 'du bas rgya mtsho ni phyogs bzhi nas 'bab pa'i chu thams cad kyi gzhi yin no //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi nas chu bo bzhi yan lag mang po dang bcas pa phyogs bzhi nas babs kyang gzhi rgya mtsho chen po las babs par 'du bas rgya mtsho ni phyogs bzhi nas 'bab pa'i chu thams cad kyi gzhi yin no //
translated: The four rivers that flow from the four directions with many tributaries flow from the four directions and converge into the great ocean, so the ocean is the basis of all the water that flows from the four directions.

original: spyi yin no //
analyzed: spyi yin no //
translated: The five perfections are the basis of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga tha dad kyang ngas mdo sde bcu gnyis bshad pa la brten pa yin pas mdo sde bcu gnyis ni gzhi yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga tha dad kyang ngas mdo sde bcu gnyis bshad pa la brten pa yin pas mdo sde bcu gnyis ni gzhi yin no //
translated: Likewise, although there are five different extremes of investigation of phenomena, since they are based on my explanation of the twelve branches of scripture, the twelve branches of scripture are the basis.

original: spyi yin no //
analyzed: spyi yin no //
translated: They are the general [topic].

original: 'jam dpal / khyod 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod 'di skad du /
translated: Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, you say:

original: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag ltar so sor rtog pa'i gang zag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ba lags sam zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag ltar so sor rtog pa'i gang zag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na'ang 'byung bar 'gyur ba lags sam zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Will there be any person who will discern these five extremes of investigation of phenomena in this way in the future?

original: da ltar ngas chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa na'ang 'khor 'dus ba rnams la rtog pa 'di lta bur tha dad par gyur nga mya ngan las 'das nas tha dad par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: da ltar ngas chos rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa na'ang 'khor 'dus ba rnams la rtog pa 'di lta bur tha dad par gyur nga mya ngan las 'das nas tha dad par 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
translated: Even now, when I teach the intrinsic nature of phenomena just as it is, there are different concepts among the assembled retinue. What need is there to mention that after I pass into nirvƒÅ·πáa, there will be even more differences.

original: ches mang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ches mang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be even greater.

original: 'jam dpal / nga mya ngan las 'das nas lo lnga brgya dang / dgu brgya dang / stong dgu brgya dang / nyis stong dang / nyis stong lnga brgya'i bar du chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la so sor rtog pa'i gang @274a *//
analyzed: 'jam dpal / nga mya ngan las 'das nas lo lnga brgya dang / dgu brgya dang / stong dgu brgya dang / nyis stong dang / nyis stong lnga brgya'i bar du chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la so sor rtog pa'i gang @274a *//
translated: Manjushri, five hundred years after my nirvana, and nine hundred years, and one thousand nine hundred years, and two thousand years, and two thousand five hundred years, these five limits of investigation into the Dharma will be investigated.

original: zag rim par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag rim par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Manjusri, after my Nirvana, for five hundred years, for nine hundred years, for one thousand nine hundred years, for two thousand years, and for two thousand five hundred years, there will be individuals who will investigate these five limits of the Dharma.

original: 'jam dpal / khyod 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'jam dpal / khyod 'di skad du /
translated: Manjusri, you ask,

original: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la slob pa'i gang zag rnams la don lags pa dang ma lags par rtsod par mi 'gyur lags sam zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag la slob pa'i gang zag rnams la don lags pa dang ma lags par rtsod par mi 'gyur lags sam zhes zer ba ni /
translated: 'Will there be no dispute over the meaning of these five limits of the Dharma for those individuals who study them?'

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus nga mya ngan las 'das nas lo lnga brgya nas rtsod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus nga mya ngan las 'das nas lo lnga brgya nas rtsod par 'gyur te /
translated: In the future, after my Nirvana, for five hundred years, there will be dispute.

original: de'i tshe gang zag rnams mos pa dang shes rab che chung gi dbang gis don ma nor bar rtogs ma rtogs kyi bye brag med par bdag nyid kyi don ma yin pa la yin nges par byas te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gang zag rnams mos pa dang shes rab che chung gi dbang gis don ma nor bar rtogs ma rtogs kyi bye brag med par bdag nyid kyi don ma yin pa la yin nges par byas te /
translated: At that time, individuals, without distinguishing whether they have understood the meaning correctly or not, will be certain that their own meaning is the meaning.

original: gzhan gyi don yin pa'ang ma yin par bsgrubs nas rtsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yin pa'ang ma yin par bsgrubs nas rtsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will argue, having established that it is not for the sake of others.

original: gzhan drung na 'khod cing nyan pa rnams kyis kyang don bzhin du phyogs 'dzin par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: gzhan drung na 'khod cing nyan pa rnams kyis kyang don bzhin du phyogs 'dzin par mi byed kyi /
translated: Even those who are present and listen will not take sides in accordance with the facts.

original: yul gyis bsdus pa dang gnyen gyi phyogs 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gyis bsdus pa dang gnyen gyi phyogs 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will take sides based on where they are from or who their friends are.

original: don ma nor bar shes pa rnams kyis kyang mi shes pa rnams la bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi rtsod kyi /
analyzed: don ma nor bar shes pa rnams kyis kyang mi shes pa rnams la bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi rtsod kyi /
translated: Even those who understand the meaning correctly will not argue in order to teach those who do not understand.

original: smad bab pa dang shed gcad pa'i phyir rtsod de /
analyzed: smad bab pa dang shed gcad pa'i phyir rtsod de /
translated: They will argue in order to be disparaging and to be critical.

original: khyod kyi don gyi ngo bo ji ltar mthong ba smros zhes dris nas /
analyzed: khyod kyi don gyi ngo bo ji ltar mthong ba smros zhes dris nas /
translated: They will ask, ‚ÄúTell us what the nature of the meaning that you have seen is.‚ÄùüîΩAnd when they have told it, they will say, ‚ÄúThat is not the meaning,‚Äù and they will quote from other s≈´tras.

original: des smras pa dang / don ma nor yang mdo sde gzhan la brtsams nas smra bar 'gyur ro; ;khyod 'di skad zer zhes nor pa gzhan la sgrogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des smras pa dang / don ma nor yang mdo sde gzhan la brtsams nas smra bar 'gyur ro; ;khyod 'di skad zer zhes nor pa gzhan la sgrogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will say, ‚ÄúYou said this,‚Äù and they will proclaim your error.

original: bdag nyid las ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis ma shes na ci ma rung snyam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid las ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis ma shes na ci ma rung snyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will think, ‚ÄúHow nice it would be if no one else knew about this except me.‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi phyir ma @274b yin gyi zang zing gi phyir sgrogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir ma @274b yin gyi zang zing gi phyir sgrogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will proclaim it not for the sake of Awakening, but for the sake of material wealth.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / 'jam dpal gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / 'jam dpal gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When this had been said, Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One,

original: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag chos kyi gzhi gcig la tha dad par 'gyur na chos kyi gzhi de ni gang lags /
analyzed: chos la brtag pa'i mtha' lnga po 'di dag chos kyi gzhi gcig la tha dad par 'gyur na chos kyi gzhi de ni gang lags /
translated: if these five theoretical extremes regarding phenomena are different in one basis of phenomena, what is that basis of phenomena?

original: de la ji ltar brtags na ni 'khrul pa lags /
analyzed: de la ji ltar brtags na ni 'khrul pa lags /
translated: How is it that one is mistaken in analyzing it?

original: de'i ma nor ba'i rang gi ngo bo ni gang lags /
analyzed: de'i ma nor ba'i rang gi ngo bo ni gang lags /
translated: What is its unmistaken intrinsic nature?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: 'jam dpal / gzhi ni phung po rnams so //üîΩ'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal / gzhi ni phung po rnams so // 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúMa√±ju≈õrƒ´, the basis is the aggregates,üîΩthe elements,

original: khams dang skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched rnams so //
translated: and the sense spheres.

original: de dag sgyu ma bzhin tha snyad tsam du snang ba las rtag pa dang thar zug tu bzung na 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag sgyu ma bzhin tha snyad tsam du snang ba las rtag pa dang thar zug tu bzung na 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: If one grasps them as permanent or eternal, one is mistaken, because they appear merely conventionally, like an illusion.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin skye ba med pa la dngos po tha snyad du snang ba bsal nas med par brtags na'ang 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin skye ba med pa la dngos po tha snyad du snang ba bsal nas med par brtags na'ang 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Even if one analyzes the non-arising of the nature of things, thinking that the appearance of things as conventional entities is eliminated and does not exist, that is a mistake.

original: de'i gzhi ma nor ba'i rang gi ngo bo chos de dag gi rang bzhin skye ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i gzhi ma nor ba'i rang gi ngo bo chos de dag gi rang bzhin skye ba med pa yin no //
translated: The unmistaken basis of that is the nature of those phenomena, which is non-arising.

original: gsol pa / 'o na yul 'khrul pa'i gzhi ma mchis na yul 'khrul pa snang zhes bya ba ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / 'o na yul 'khrul pa'i gzhi ma mchis na yul 'khrul pa snang zhes bya ba ji lta bu lags /
translated: It was asked, ‚ÄúIf there is no basis for the error of objects, how is it said that the error of objects appears?‚Äù

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:

original: chos sgyu ma bzhin tha snyad tsam du snang zhing yod pa de sems 'khrul pas snang bar ni mi bzung gi /
analyzed: chos sgyu ma bzhin tha snyad tsam du snang zhing yod pa de sems 'khrul pas snang bar ni mi bzung gi /
translated: ‚ÄúThe appearance of phenomena, which is like an illusion and is merely conventional, is not to be grasped as an appearance due to the error of mind.

original: chos de dag gi rang bzhin skye ba med par mi shes nas rtag pa ther zug tu bzung ba'i 'khrul pa'i snang ba la sems 'khrul pa yul du snang bar zungs shig /
analyzed: chos de dag gi rang bzhin skye ba med par mi shes nas rtag pa ther zug tu bzung ba'i 'khrul pa'i snang ba la sems 'khrul pa yul du snang bar zungs shig /
translated: Without understanding the nature of those phenomena, which is non-arising, grasp the appearance of the error of mind as an object in the appearance of the error of grasping things as permanent and stable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos rnams la gang gis rtag pa dang ther zug tu bzung na 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rnams la gang gis rtag pa dang ther zug tu bzung na 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one grasps phenomena as permanent and stable, one will cycle in sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: 'khor bar gyur @275a *//
analyzed: 'khor bar gyur @275a *//
translated: Having cycled in sa·πÉsƒÅra,

original: na phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres would exist.

original: de yod na bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnams myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod na bde ba dang sdug bsngal rnams myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they exist, then there would be the experience of pleasure and pain.

original: gang gis chos rnams gyi rang bzhin skye ba med pa shes nas chos rnams kyi dngos po rtag pa ther zug dang / med pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis po bsal na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis chos rnams gyi rang bzhin skye ba med pa shes nas chos rnams kyi dngos po rtag pa ther zug dang / med pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis po bsal na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If one understands the unborn nature of phenomena, and if one eliminates the two extremes of existence and nonexistence, permanence and annihilation, then one will attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de thob pa dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de thob pa dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one attains that, the major and minor marks and the pure buddha field will appear.
